title: Kelly Clarkson's new talk show is a hit. Here's why that's a big deal
text:
New York (CNN Business) Kelly Clarkson kicks off each episode of her new daytime show with something she calls "Kellyoke," a cover of a recent or classic pop song.

It's hard to figure out if "The Kelly Clarkson Show" is daytime variety show or daytime talk show. Whatever it is, it's working with viewers.

Since debuting last month, the show is averaging roughly 1.9 million viewers per episode. That's good enough to put Clarkson in fourth place among daytime talk shows, according to Nielsen data.

Fourth place may not seem like much, but the show, which is syndicated by NBCUniversal Television, is only behind shows that have been on air for years. That includes "Ellen," "Live with Kelly and Ryan" and "Dr. Phil," which has led daytime talk with an average of about 3.1 million viewers per episode so far this season.
